quest.name: For Love of the Moon
journal: Hien would know more of your captors and their ways.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: ...I know what you're thinking. And yes, I could probably have convinced him to let us go had I handled that differently. But then we would have learned naught for our troubles.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: If there is one thing I know, it is that men of faith yearn to share it with others. And in learning more of their beliefs, we may learn more of other things─things which may prove useful in the Naadam.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: When I was carrying out my tasks, I met an elder─a storyteller─named Udutai. Mayhap he can be our teacher.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: This is the man of whom I spoke, Udutai.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: Hm? I can spare no time for you. Other troubles demand my attention.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: What troubles? What ill fortune has befallen you?

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: Not me, but my lambs. Some few wandered far and have yet to return.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: Mayhap they will return to their mothers in time. Mayhap they will not. Mayhap you can help?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: If we must, then we must. Let us be about it, Forename.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Where are you, little ones? Your mother is waiting! It is time to come home!

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: They cannot have gone below. They must be here somewhere...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Greetings. I trust all of our little explorers are safely accounted for?

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: That they are. My thanks to you, Doman. Now─you had questions for me?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Aye. I would know more of the Oronir─of their creation, and of Father Azim.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: As you wish. Come, let us sit.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: Before we begin, tell me: what do you know of the Au Ra, and how they came to be?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: In the days before men, Azim and Nhaama waged a bitter war...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The Raen were born of the Dawn Father and the Xaela of the Dusk Mother...

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: Yes, yes. A common tale, and one believed by many tribes.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: But what it does not mention is this: Azim and Nhaama were lovers.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: Oh, they fought in the beginning, as did their creations. That much is true. But when they saw how the Xaela and the Raen rose above their hatreds and joined hands in harmony, their hearts stirred, and the love their children shared became theirs as well.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: Alas, he was of the sun and she of the moon. Apart they must remain, lest day and night cease to be, and with them all creation.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: With sadness in their hearts they returned to the heavens─he to the day, she to the night, destined to walk before and after, never to meet.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: As time passed, Azim's yearning for his beloved grew deeper still. Was there truly naught that could be done, he wondered. At last, he knew.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: "If the Father cannot be with the Mother, then he shall go amongst her children. Now and ever after.“

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: So it was that Azim took a fragment of his being and with it fashioned an avatar. Clad in scale of midnight, he descended, and sought out the Xaela.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: Yea, he was the first Oronir. We are of his flesh and his blood. We are the children of Azim, and it is our duty to watch over and keep the Xaela safe.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: ...I confess, I did not expect the tale of your people's beginnings to be quite so romantic.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Yet I must ask: if it is your duty to defend the Xaela, how can you go to war with them in the Naadam? Is that not a contradiction?

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: If a father disciplines his son, does that mean there is no love in his heart? Xaela are not wont to kneel. They must be made to─only then will they heed reason.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: I see... Such is the way of the Steppe.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Thank you, elder, for sharing with us your wisdom.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: Eager to depart? Ere you go, you would do well to hear the end of my tale.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: When Nhaama looked down and saw the avatar of Azim, she knew him at once, and shed tears of love and longing.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: When they struck the earth, they rose anew, as a counterpart to the Oronir. Their fates entwined.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: So you see, for every son of Azim is a daughter of Nhaama for whom he must search. Even now.

dialogue.name: UDUTAI
dialogue.text: Come again, traveler. There are tales to be told, songs to be sung.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Mayhap I am being overly optimistic, but I sense that these Oronir may prove loyal allies to Doma under the right circumstances.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Their arrogance is rooted in the belief that they must act as caretakers of all Xaela. Therefore, if we can prove to them that we come as kindred spirits, seeking to defeat a common foe...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: But mayhap this is a discussion for after we win the Naadam. Come, let us return to Magnai.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: You're back. They had me milking sheep, by the way. It was, um, interesting...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Another “task” completed, eh? I wonder what the most radiant brother has in store for us next.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: At a glance, their arms and armor may seem crude compared to those of Doma, but they are well crafted, and no less effective.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Hmm...you shine with the light of newfound wisdom. Could it be that you have at last accepted the supremacy of the Sun?

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: No matter. You have each completed your tasks, and proven yourselves deserving of mercy.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: However, if it is freedom you desire, then there is one more thing you must do...
